Pago Pago is approximately 16 miles from the
). The small terminal is in the process of expanding and taxis are always available when exiting the building.  There does not seem to be a lot of air traffic, except for flights to/fro
.  The cost of a taxi ride from Tafuna to Pago Pago is usually $15-$20, and $1.00 on a
.  Most hotels on the island offer pick-up and shuttle service if arranged in advance.

value: content=A museum that showcases Samoan history, culture, and nature, it's a great place to learn about the island and become acquainted with the local culture before venturing out to other destinations. The museum features many cultural artifacts, such as clothing, art, weaponry, pottery, and tattooing. There are also artifacts from WWII. Exhibits about the island itself, including the types of plants and animals are also on display. The museum is named after the wife of the founder, who collected many of the artifacts on display in the museum.
File:RAINMAKER HOTEL, PAGO PAGO, AMERICAN SAMOA.jpg
content=Formerly known as The Rainmaker Hotel (aka The Ratmaker) the hotel has been much improved in recent years.
content= Sadie Thompson was the prostitute who featured in the short story "Rain" by Somerset Maugham. There are 12 rooms for $135 and 2 apartments for $175.
directions=just a few minutes from the airport
content=100 rooms in this hotel built in 2003.  Clean and well maintained.
